3: Based on your request, we'll clear out these parts of the base for other purposes, Commandant.
The cleared areas will be partitioned according to their spaces and the plans to make future constructions easier.
I'll provide you with the detailed proposal later. Commandant, all you've got to do is choose and sign.
...The bride in the white gown and the groom in the black suit exchange their rings in the church.
And then...

4: Are you talking about a wedding?

3: Commandant?!
I-I'm sorry, I didn't know you were... Ahem...
Can I help you with something, Commandant?
We should be the ones asking you that. What are you reading?
...Weddings? Was that why you were gawking at the church last time? Are you interested in that?
I can understand that you might get curious when your new frame looks like a wedding gown.
But marriages aren't as wonderful as you think they'd be.
You don't get it, Lee! The union between two people is sacred!

2: Did you just get angry, Liv...?
4: Yeah, Lee, that was uncalled for.

3: I'm sorry... I was...
Liv, you know that weddings aren't for us Constructs.
I'm not opposing them for any special reasons. I just think that we're better off not thinking about something that won't concern us.
Despite what you said, Lee... As a woman, I think they are still something we would envision...
I get it... but I can't let go of the idea of a bride in my head...

2: Then let's go to the church again next time.
4: Should we give this marriage thing a shot?

3: I can't ask you to take time away just to accompany me, Commandant. And I've got work to do as well.
Marriage... no, I... I just want to go take a look.
Go with Commandant, then.
Lee?
You'll just keep thinking about it if you don't, won't you?
I'll rearrange our missions so that we can visit the church again.
